Business.title: How Does Japan Intervene in Currency Markets?
Business.desc: Speculation that Japan may intervene to support its currency reignited repeatedly this year as the yen plunged to 24-year lows against the US dollar. In mid-September, the Bank of Japan was said to have conducted a so-called rate check, a move often considered a precursor for actual intervention. Days later, it did just that, stepping in to support the yen for the first time since 1998. A month later, it jumped in again. These were extraordinary moves for a country that’s long been criticized by
